revised_title: Influence of Trypanosoma Strains on Rat Paralysis
tldr: The author conducted experiments on rats to study the effects of trypanosoma strains from Gambia Fever and Sleeping Sickness. They discovered that some strains caused paralysis in rats, while others did not. The author found that trypanosomata were rarely found in the blood of paralyzed rats, and that the site of inoculation determined the location of paralysis. This research highlights the importance of studying the pathogenic action of trypanosomata for better understanding and differentiation between similar organisms.
